alert.note: Alert for Coachella Valley; San Diego County Deserts; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 01 at 7:54AM PDT until September 01 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following areas, Coachella Valley, San Diego County Deserts and San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning. * WHEN...From Noon today to 7 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Increased moisture and instability will create an environment conducive to thunderstorms that could produce areas of heavy rainfall this afternoon and evening. Rainfall rates of 0.75 to 1 inch per hour are possible. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Coachella Valley; San Diego County Deserts; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning
